parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To stoop, peer in, look down, look intently. From para and kupto; to bend beside, i.e. Lean over.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (primarily physical), I look, see, perceive, discern. A primary verb; to look at.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A linen bandage, a wrapping. Neuter of a presumed derivative of othone; a linen bandage.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: To lie, recline, be placed, be laid, set, specially appointed, destined. Middle voice of a primary verb; to lie outstretched.
(a) indeed, really, (b) yet, however, nevertheless. From Not Used and toi; indeed though, i.e. However.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
